definition: to take a laissez-faire attitude
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: I cannot pass the matter by without making a protest.
sentences.chinese: 我不能对此事听之任之。

sentences.english: When velocity swings widely, the Fed shouldn't be passive.
sentences.chinese: 当周转率大幅摆动时，联储不该听之任之。

sentences.english: Therefore, no longer on the "Real's" acts go unheeded .
sentences.chinese: 因此，不能再对“炒房团”的行为听之任之。

sentences.english: It's short-sighted to think you can optimize your Web site and leave it be.
sentences.chinese: 如果认为你优化完网站就听之任之，这是目光短浅的。

sentences.english: Some local officials reinforced their dykes; others allowed them to fail.
sentences.chinese: 当地有些官员采取措施加固大坝，有的则听之任之。

sentences.english: We can't take a laissez-faire attitude to drug abuse.
sentences.chinese: 我们对毒品泛滥不能听之任之。

definition: to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to turn a blind eye

definition: to play deaf-mute
to turn a blind eye

to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
to ignore/to let alone/to indulge
excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
